text.div:
GenomicsReporting

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/genomics-reporting/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.uv.genomics-reporting

Guidelines for reporting of clinical genomics results using HL7 FHIR.

name: GenomicsReporting
title: Genomics Reporting Implementation Guide
description: Guidelines for reporting of clinical genomics results using HL7 FHIR.

resource.name: Coded Annotation
resource.description: Annotation DataType with added CodeableConcept extension element

resource.name: Diagnostic Implication
resource.description: Observation stating a linkage between one or more genotype/haplotype/variation Observations and evidence for or against a particular disease, condition, or cancer diagnosis.

resource.name: Followup Recommendation
resource.description: Task describing the follow-up that is recommended

resource.name: Genomics Finding
resource.description: Properties common to genetic findings whose results are expressed as computable discrete elements (e.g. genotypes, haplotypes, variants, etc.).

resource.name: Genomics Implication
resource.description: Properties common to genomic implications expressed as computable discrete elements.

resource.name: Genomics Base
resource.description: Base profile that defines characteristics shared by all genetic observations.

resource.name: Genomics DocumentReference
resource.description: A profile of DocumentReference used to represent a genomics file.

resource.name: Genomics Report
resource.description: Genomics profile of DiagnosticReport.

resource.name: Genotype
resource.description: Assertion of a particular genotype on the basis of one or more variants or haplotypes.

resource.name: Haplotype
resource.description: Assertion of a particular haplotype on the basis of one or more variants.

resource.name: Microsatellite Instability
resource.description: Microsatellite Instability (MSI) is the condition of genetic hypermutability (predisposition to mutation) that results from impaired DNA mismatch repair (MMR).

resource.name: Medication Recommendation
resource.description: Task proposing medication recommendations based on genetic results.

resource.name: Overall Interpretation
resource.description: Provides a coarse overall interpretation of the genomic results reported.

resource.name: Region Studied
resource.description: The Region Studied profile is used to assert actual regions studied for the performed test(s). Intended coverage areas may differ from actual coverage areas (e.g. due to technical limitations during test performance).

resource.name: Sequence Phase Relationship
resource.description: Indicates whether two entities are in Cis (same strand) or Trans (opposite strand) relationship to each other.

resource.name: Tumor Mutation Burden
resource.description: The total number of mutations (changes) found in the DNA of cancer cells. Knowing the tumor mutational burden may help plan the best treatment. For example, tumors that have a high number of mutations appear to be more likely to respond to certain types of immunotherapy. Tumor mutational burden is being used as a type of biomarker.

resource.name: Therapeutic Implication
resource.description: Profile with properties for observations that convey the potential impact of genomic characteristics on a medication or non-medicinal therapy.

resource.name: Variant
resource.description: Details about a set of changes in the tested sample compared to a reference sequence.

resource.name: Annotation Code
resource.description: Codifies the content of an Annotation

resource.name: Genomic Report Note
resource.description: Adds codified notes to a report to capture additional content

resource.name: Genomics Artifact
resource.description: Captures citations, evidence and other supporting documentation for the observation or report.

resource.name: Genomics File
resource.description: Used to transmit the contents of or links to files that were produced as part of the testing process. Examples are VCF, BAM, CRAM, and other similar files.

resource.name: Genomics Risk Assessment
resource.description: RiskAssessment delivered as part of a genomics report or observation

resource.name: Medication Assessed
resource.description: Used to reference a specific medication that was assessed (e.g. a FHIR Medication or a FHIR MedicationKnowledge).

resource.name: Recommended Action
resource.description: References a proposed action that is recommended based on the results of the diagnostic report.

resource.name: Therapy Assessed
resource.description: Used to reference a specific therapy that was assessed (e.g. a FHIR ResearchStudy, a FHIR CarePlan, or a FHIR PlanDefinition).

resource.name: Coded Annotation Types
resource.description: Value Set for specific types of coded annotations

resource.name: Condition Inheritance Patterns
resource.description: Value Set for specific transmission patterns of a condition in a pedigree

resource.name: DNA Change Type
resource.description: DNA Change Type of a variant.

resource.name: Evidence Level Examples
resource.description: Example sources of values for Evidence Level

resource.name: Functional Effect
resource.description: The effect of a variant on downstream biological products or pathways.

resource.name: Genetic Therapeutic Implications
resource.description: Value Set for terms that describe a predicted ramification based on the presence of associated molecular finding(s).

resource.name: HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee Gene Names (HGNC)
resource.description: This value set includes all HGNC Codes, which includes multiple code systems. In this guide, Gene IDs from HGNC are used as CodeableConcepts, which must be sent with the HGNC gene ID including the prefix 'HGNC:' as the code and the HGNC 'gene symbol' as display. CAUTION: HGNC also indexes gene groups by numeric ID (without a prefix), and older systems may send HGNC gene IDs without the prefix, so care must be taken to confirm alignment. We have separately included the genegroup code system to draw attention to this ambiguity and potential error.

resource.name: Human Genome Variation Society (HGVS) Nomenclature
resource.description: HGVS-nomenclature is used to report and exchange information regarding variants found in DNA, RNA and protein sequences and serves as an international standard. (source: varnomen.hgvs.org)

resource.name: High Low codes
resource.description: This value set includes high/low codes for Observation Interpretations

resource.name: Molecular Consequence
resource.description: The calculated or observed effect of a variant on its downstream transcript and, if applicable, ensuing protein sequence.

resource.name: Sequence Phase Relationships
resource.description: Value Set for specific types of relationships

resource.name: To Be Determined Value Set
resource.description: Value Set for codes yet to be defined in LOINC

resource.name: Variant Confidence Status
resource.description: A code that classifies the confidence for calling this variant.

resource.name: Variant Inheritances
resource.description: By which parent the variant was inherited in the patient, if known.

resource.name: ClinVar Evidence Level Example Codes
resource.description: ClinVar contains examples of evidence level concepts that are not conflated with clinical significance. These can be found on  ClinVar https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar/docs/review_status/ . These examples are informational only, for copyright information contact the relevant source.

resource.name: Coded Annotation Type Codes
resource.description: Code System for specific types of coded annotations

resource.name: PharmGKB Evidence Level Example Codes
resource.description: PharmGKB contains examples of evidence level concepts that are not conflated with clinical significance. These can be found on PharmGKB https://www.pharmgkb.org/page/clinAnnLevels. These examples are informational only, for copyright information contact the relevant source.

resource.name: Sequence Phase Relationship Codes
resource.description: Code System for specific types of relationships

resource.name: To Be Determined Codes
resource.description: These codes are currently 'TBD' codes. The CG WG plans to request formal LOINC codes to replace these codes as these concepts are validated.

resource.name: Variant Confidence Status Codes
resource.description: A code that represents the confidence of a true positive variant call.

resource.name: Find Subject Variants
resource.description: Use this operation to retrieve variants with precise endpoints from a specified genomic region for a specified patient. If the range in question has been studied, the operation returns a FHIR Parameters resource containing variants overlapping the region. If the patient or the specified region has not been studied, the operation returns a 404 error.
